description: Keep nesting minimal and control flow straightforward. Use guard clauses to reduce nesting and extract nested blocks into separate functions.

do.description: Keep control flow simple and readable
content: Use guard clauses to reduce nesting
Extract nested blocks into separate functions
Prefer early returns for edge cases
- Use polymorphism instead of complex switch statements

dont.description: Don't create deeply nested control structures
content: Don't nest conditionals more than 2-3 levels deep
Don't use complex switch statements outside factory methods
Don't mix multiple control flow patterns in one function
- Switch statement with business logic in each case
- Mixed for loops with nested if/else/switch
- Multiple exit points deep in nested blocks
- Switch statements with complex logic per case
- Use guard clauses at function start
- Replace switch with polymorphism or lookup tables
- Use early returns to flatten structure
- Consider strategy pattern for complex branching
